member.name: ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamNotify.OnAvailableDynamicObjectCountChange
member.summary: Notifies the spatial audio client when the rendering capacity for an is about to change, specifies the time after which the change will occur, and specifies the number of dynamic audio objects that will be available after the change.
member.param: The spatial audio render stream for which the available dynamic object count is changing.
The time after which the spatial resource limit will change, in 100-nanosecond units. A value of 0 means that the change will occur immediately.
The number of dynamic spatial audio objects that will be available to the stream after hnsComplianceDeadlineTime.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an error code.

summary.para: Provides notifications for spatial audio clients to respond to changes in the state of an .

You register the object that implements this interface by assigning it to the NotifyObject parameter of the structure passed into the method. After registering its ISpatialAudioObjectRenderStreamNotify interface, the client receives event notifications in the form of callbacks through the method in the interface.
This interface is a part of Windows Sonic, Microsoft’s audio platform for more immersive audio which includes integrated spatial sound on Xbox and Windows.
